FuncDef: The reset port-queue statistics command resets statistics about port queues on an outbound interface.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the priority of a port queue.
The value is an enumerated type and can be cs7, cs6, ef, af4, af3, af2, af1, and be.

Displays the configuration for queues in the outbound direction of an interface.
-

Specifies the slot ID of a board.
In VS mode, this parameter is supported only by the admin VS.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Specifies an interface type and interface number.
-

Examples: <HUAWEI> reset port-queue statistics interface GigabitEthernet 1/0/0 outbound
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If you consider at a moment that the previous port queue statistics on an interface to be useless or unreliable, run the reset port-queue statistics command to reset the port queue statistics on the interface.
Configuration Impact
Port queue statistics cannot be restored after being reset.
If running the reset port-queue statistics command to reset statistics about port queues on an interface, the user queue statistics is cleared as well.
In multi-VS scenarios, after this command is configured on a trunk main interface, the command configuration is also effective for the trunk sub-interfaces that reside in other VSs.
